Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of credibility assessment and risk evaluation in refugee claim
Credibility_Assessment: Board questioned applicant's credibility and knowledge of Christianity
Evidence_Type: Oral testimony, lack of documented evidence of persecution
Legal_Provision: Section 97 or 98 of IRPA (risk to life, cruel and unusual treatment)
Basis_of_Claim: Religious persecution due to involvement in underground Christian church
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of credible evidence and insufficient proof of risk in Guangdong province
Proceeding_Type: Refugee protection hearing followed by judicial review
Decision_Maker: Refugee Protection Division of the Immigration and Refugee Board
Regulation_Cited: IRPR Section 101 or similar provisions on refugee eligibility
Legal_Standard: Standard of reasonableness applies to administrative decisions
Application_Factor: Applicant's religious activities and fear of return to China
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Administrative law principles; Charter considerations may apply indirectly
Cause_of_Refusal: Credibility concerns and lack of objective evidence of risk
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA s. 96-98; principles of procedural fairness
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient personal details about religious practice, lack of corroborating documents
Credibility_Issues: Doubts about depth of religious knowledge and consistency of claims
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on alleged unreasonableness of decision
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms (indirectly)
Procedural_Issue: Alleged lack of fair opportunity to respond
Omission_Type: Failure to provide sufficient detail on religious involvement
